{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3155835,"name":"Nathan Miller","username":"NMiller","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nmiller/{size}/183295_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-02T14:18:10.935Z","cooked":"

Hey so we’re having trouble with our wireless connection. We have the Frc radio plugged in the 12V2A on the VRM and everything else is also plugged in fine. We’re able to connect to the radio on the computer itself, but it won’t communicate with the drive station. Any ideas?

image4032×3024 2.76 MB

image3024×4032 3.75 MB

(Also I know our wiring isn’t great but it works)

Try a new Ethernet cable?

I can’t tell from the pic, are the network lights lighting up on the Roborio where the network cable is plugged in. I pretty sure they should be if you have an active network connection on that cable. If not, try plugging the network cable into the second port onto the radio instead of POE. I know this is not good long term, but a good test step to see if it’s the cable, or the POE.

Also, has the roborio been formatted and updated with this season’s software using the roboRIO imaging tool?
